body.name: MDD (MDD20TSATA25672E) 20TB 7200 RPM 256MB Cache SATA 6.0Gb/s 3.5" Internal Enterprise Hard Drive - 5 Years Warranty (Renewed)
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tomorrow, February 13. Order within 9 hrs 27 mins
features: HIGH-DENSITY STORAGE - 20TB hard disk drive designed for Hyperscale applications/cloud data centers solutions requiring maximum storage efficiency. 3.5-inch form factor for space-constrained data centers. FAST DATA ACCESS - 6Gb/s SATA for high data integrity, scalability and fast data access.
HIGHEST-RELIABILITY - The industry’s highest-reliability 7200-RPM drive, designed for 24×7 operation with MTBF of 2.0M hours and AFR of 0.44%.
Bare Drive Only, Single Pack, (No Screws, Cables or Accessories included) -Friendly Reminder- Please FORMAT HDD on system in order to be detected/shows on system.
Works for Desktop PC/Mac, RAID System, NAS Network Storage, CCTV DVR, Surveillance System
5 Years Warranty from Reseller, Worry Free Return! 100% Full Refund.
body.description: Supporting the industry's best response times for an 20TB a nearline drive, the MDD 3.5 HDD enables the fastest data transfers thanks to our comprehensive advanced caching technology.Meet your storage workload requirements in the most efficient and cost-effective data center footprint available on the market. When building maximum density server and storage solutions with the 20TB Enterprise Capacity 3.5 HDD, you can rest easy knowing that your storage infrastructure can scale to meet your growing capacity needs, while offering your users a consistent and predictable response rate. Built to support enterprise-class nearline workloads of 550TB/yr, and backed by 2M hours MTBF as well as a 5-Year Limited Warranty, the Enterprise Capacity 3.5 HDD helps to ensure you can meet all of your bulk storage SLAs. High capacity storage for multi-drive chassis requires predictable and reliable performance. The Enterprise Capacity 3.5 HDD is built to support enterprise-class nearline workloads of up 550 TB per year, which is up to 10x the rated workload of desktop HDDs. Clearly, the Enterprise Capacity 3.5 HDD can help to ensure that you meet your rigorous bulk storage SLAs. Best-Fit Applications Hyperscale applications/cloud data centers with replicated storage Massive scale-out data centers and big data analytics High-capacity density RAID storage Mainstream enterprise external storage arrays (SAN, NAS, DAS) Distributed file systems, including Hadoop and Ceph Enterprise backup and restore-D2D, virtual tape Surveillance System Storage Desktop Computer PC

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good value for the money
reviews.reviewText: Using in a mirrored NAS setup and working great (bought 2 drives)! 1 month in, zero problems and after drive balancing a little, each drive is 70% utilized and no errors. If my use-rate remains constant, I should have a couple years before I need to expand again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great internal hard drive and great cost
reviews.reviewText: We bought this because we wanted a LOT of space for our own internal server in our home (why pay someone $150/yr to store your files when you can do it yourself for free). This was quick and easy to install into our desktop and we created a folder in it for network sharing. Easy to use, and great cost savings.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Mixed bag with refurb drives but generally OK
reviews.reviewText: Update: I exchanged the defective drive for another identical one (easy with Amazon returns) and it works fine so raised this to 4 stars. Original review: I purchase these refurb drives as a cheap way to back up my entire home business desktop system for off-site storage. Multiple backups exist so this is not 100% critical or under heavy repeated use in my case but I do need them to work if I lose my system for some reason. I've had good luck with one refurb drive from Amazon but the one received on this date (20TB size MDD Enterprise Drive says the label, no idea what's actually inside) would only click and clack oddly and never spin up to mount on my desktop (not visible in Disk Utility on Mac either). I'm letting Amazon send another one with their fairly painless return process and will try again (returning the defective drive of course). You can't beat the price but they do have to work.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works so far
reviews.reviewText: Working well so far. Checked the SMART datat and everything is in order. Plan to use the 20tb HDD x3 in a NAS. Will try and update the review overtime.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Works right up on Linux on an Internal Hard Drive unlike the NAS copy of this drive.
